page.title: 10MILLHOUSE
page.content: Millhouse is a remand home.During the war it was used by the officers at Hadrian's Camp.It had been taken over from the Carr family.After the war it was taken over by the home office and used as an approved home until 1969. Nowadays it is used as a remand home.The Victorian chimneys are still standing and also inside the home there is decoration around the ceiling.This is said to be worth more than the whole of the home put together.It has still got some medievil windows and some emblems.They are the rose,the portculis,the bird and the acorns.The oak work was made in 1922.Also there is a stream over which there is a bridge built in 1921. At any one time there is a maximum of 28 children. Finn Lawrence Stephen Hewgill.
